text: public transportation such as metros
buses and trains fascinate me I have a
weird obsession with them whenever I
enter a new city the first thing I do is
ride the Metro it introduces me to the
culture the people and gives me a feel
for what the country is all about in
most big Asian cities of 10 million plus
people I find the metro system to be
efficient and enjoyable like in Taipei
Seoul Bangkok Hong Kong Singapore
Beijing Tashkent Shanghai and even
Jerusalem all of these cities have
immaculate metro systems they don't
require common sense to use them it's as
easy as can be
but in Manila it's a different story
it's a complete disaster to get around
so the trees come in but there's people
like selling stuff on the tracks right
there anything the traffic here is
amongst the worst on earth seriously it
takes 2 to 3 hours to drive 15
kilometers if you're lucky you think by
now they'd have an efficient metro
system figured out there's actually been
an MRT here for 20-some years but it's
horrendous I'd rather sit in traffic all
day than ride the MRT it's hot smelly
and overly crowded so I'm about to ride
MRT here in Manila for the very first
time and I had to hide my camera because
the police kept stopping me from filming
there's no bathrooms no sanitation no
advertisements no enjoyment whatsoever
push push push the pushing the beans
that's supposed to be a clock which
wasn't
but didn't take a cabinet no you get
that they only sell one-way ticket
rush-hour gets so aggressive that they
were forced to make a woman's only
section because some men are too violent
so I was just standing in the female
line and I got kicked out by a security
guard like in two seconds and don't even
try to step on this yellow line in case
you are wondering a lack of funding is
not the issue for why the MRT sucks in
Manila in 2012 billions of pesos were
set aside to expand and decongest to MRT
they created new stations and built 48
new trains all of which are still not
usable today because of technical
difficulties and faulty designs how does
that even happen 248 trains let's talk
about public buses they are debatably
worse than the MRT we're about to take
the bus they don't run on any schedule
meaning they go whenever it's packed to
the brim with passengers so you can
either wait one minute or one hour if
all seats are full than its standing
section only the AC is always blasting
cold air and the driver will never turn
it off but at least it costs only 18
pesos and they play the Filipino voice
on TV there needs to be a solution to
clean up this traffic as more than 15
million people called Metro Manila their
home things are getting busier jeepneys
need to take their daily passengers
giant trucks need to deliver their goods
and taxis need to take their passengers
this is a nightmare if it's rush hour
then my advice is to avoid the streets
avoid the metro and just stay at home
that's the harsh reality here in Manila
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
videos please click Subscribe and join
me as I plan to visit every country in
the world
